content:
The ligand L was prepared according to Scheme 1. 1,4-dibromo-2,3-butanedione was synthesized by the adoption of a literature procedure.13 2,3-bis(bromomethyl)quinoxaline was prepared by the condensation reaction of an equimolar amount of 1,4-dibromo-2,3-butanedione and 1,2-diaminobenzene in ethanol at reflux for ca. 2 h with a yield of 83%. The reaction of 2,3-bis(bromomethyl)quinoxaline with the appropriate 5-methyl-2-sulfanyl-1,3,4-thiadiazole, in the presence of KOH, gaves the ligand 2,3-bis(5-methyl-1,3,4-thiadiazole-2-thiomethyl)quinoxaline (L) in good yields (84%), and the product was characterized by 1H NMR and elemental analyses. Anal. Found: C, 45.74; H, 3.49; N, 20.28. Calcd. for C16H14N6S4: C, 45.91; H, 3.37; N, 20.08. 1H NMR (CDCl3): δ 2.72 (s, 6H, –CH3), 5.10 (s, 4H, –SCH2–), 7.73 ∼ 8.07 (m, 4H, Ar–H).

Synthesis of the silver(I) complex {[AgL](BF<sub>4</sub>)}<sub>∞</sub> (<bold>1</bold>)

The solution of AgBF4 (0.1 mmol) in CH3CN (3 mL) was slowly added to the solution of L (0.1 mmol) in CHCl3 (3 mL). Slow diffusion of ether into the resulted solution yielded yellow single crystals of 1 suitable for X-ray analysis with a yield of 32%. IR (KBr, cm–1): 1698 w, 1633 w, 1569 w, 1489 m, 1427 w, 1402 m, 1210 m, 1063 vs, 777 m, 521 w; analysis calculated for C16H14AgBF4N6S4: C, 31.34; H, 2.30; N, 13.70%; found: C, 31.68; H, 2.43; N, 13.51%.
clean_text:
Synthesis of the ligand 2,3-bis(5-methyl-1,3,4-thiadiazole-2-thiomethyl)quinoxaline (L)

The ligand L was prepared according to Scheme 1. 1,4-dibromo-2,3-butanedione was synthesized by the adoption of a literature procedure.13 2,3-bis(bromomethyl)quinoxaline was prepared by the condensation reaction of an equimolar amount of 1,4-dibromo-2,3-butanedione and 1,2-diaminobenzene in ethanol at reflux for ca. 2 h with a yield of 83%. The reaction of 2,3-bis(bromomethyl)quinoxaline with the appropriate 5-methyl-2-sulfanyl-1,3,4-thiadiazole, in the presence of KOH, gaves the ligand 2,3-bis(5-methyl-1,3,4-thiadiazole-2-thiomethyl)quinoxaline (L) in good yields (84%), and the product was characterized by 1H NMR and elemental analyses. Anal. Found: C, 45.74; H, 3.49; N, 20.28. Calcd. for C16H14N6S4: C, 45.91; H, 3.37; N, 20.08. 1H NMR (CDCl3): δ 2.72 (s, 6H, -CH3), 5.10 (s, 4H, -SCH2-), 7.73 ~ 8.07 (m, 4H, Ar-H).

Synthesis of the silver(I) complex {[AgL](BF4)}∞ (1)

The solution of AgBF4 (0.1 mmol) in CH3CN (3 mL) was slowly added to the solution of L (0.1 mmol) in CHCl3 (3 mL). Slow diffusion of ether into the resulted solution yielded yellow single crystals of 1 suitable for X-ray analysis with a yield of 32%. IR (KBr, cm-1): 1698 w, 1633 w, 1569 w, 1489 m, 1427 w, 1402 m, 1210 m, 1063 vs, 777 m, 521 w; analysis calculated for C16H14AgBF4N6S4: C, 31.34; H, 2.30; N, 13.70%; found: C, 31.68; H, 2.43; N, 13.51%.
